alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Grand Isle; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 3:55AM EST until January 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow. Ice accumulations of up to a quarter of an inch and total snow accumulations of a dusting to 2 inches. * WHERE...Northern New York, the Champlain Valley and southern Vermont. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Expect hazardous travel conditions for today`s morning and evening commutes, especially outside of the immediate Champlain valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest ice accumulation amounts are expected to be across the southern Green Mountains, Adirondacks and parts of the Saint Lawrence valley where there could be locally up to four tenths of an inch of ice accumulation. This would also increase the risk of power outages due to cumulative ice accumulation on trees and powerlines. While precipitation is expected to stay mainly rain across the immediate Champlain valley, a light glaze to a few hundredths of an inch of ice is possible before changeover to light snow this afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
